Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Fiber-based HTTP server in Go that handles Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) API requests, including authentication, routing, and various SQS operations.

Struct Description: The SQS struct represents an HTTP server that processes Amazon SQS API requests. It uses Fiber framework for HTTP handling and includes queue management functionality with tenant isolation.

Fields:

App: *fiber.App - Fiber application instance for HTTP server
queue: models.Queue - Queue management interface
tenantManager: models.TenantManager - Tenant management interface
cfg: config.SQSConfig - Configuration for the SQS server

Methods:

NewSQS: (queue models.Queue, tenantManager models.TenantManager, cfg config.SQSConfig) -> *SQS - Constructor that initializes the SQS server with dependencies and configuration
Start: () -> error - Starts the HTTP server if enabled in configuration
Stop: () -> error - Gracefully shuts down the HTTP server if enabled
Action: (c *fiber.Ctx) -> error - Main request handler that routes SQS API requests based on X-Amz-Target header
SendMessage: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles SendMessage SQS operation
SendMessageBatch: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles SendMessageBatch SQS operation
ReceiveMessage: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles ReceiveMessage SQS operation
DeleteMessage: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles DeleteMessage SQS operation
ListQueues: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles ListQueues SQS operation
GetQueueURL: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles GetQueueUrl SQS operation
CreateQueue: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles CreateQueue SQS operation
GetQueueAttributes: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles GetQueueAttributes SQS operation
PurgeQueue: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles PurgeQueue SQS operation
ChangeMessageVisibility: (c *fiber.Ctx, tenantId int64) -> error - Handles ChangeMessageVisibility SQS operation
errorHandler: (ctx *fiber.Ctx, err error) -> error - Custom error handler for the Fiber app
authMiddleware: (c *fiber.Ctx) -> error - Authentication middleware for tenant validation
